messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] To blog or not to blog?
messages.msgSnippet: ... It doesn t need to be fully public. You can make it available just for the people you choose. At Blogger (Google s blog) they ll need to log in to read it
messages.messageBody:
On Nov 8, 2007, at 9:27 AM, Adrean Clark wrote:

> since its a public thing, what should I leave public or keep
> out?

It doesn't need to be fully public. You can make it available just
for the people you choose. At Blogger (Google's blog) they'll need to
log in to read it though.

Joyce

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: To blog or not to blog?
messages.msgSnippet: I noticed some of you have blogs. I m thinking abt setting one up so my husband and family can keep in touch with what we re doing and for myself to keep track
messages.messageBody:
I noticed some of you have blogs. I'm thinking abt setting one up so my
husband and family can keep in touch with what we're doing and for
myself to keep track on how we're going. Some of you have blogs, so I'm
curious --- since its a public thing, what should I leave public or keep
out? What would cause the state to come knocking on my door?
--Adrean
